articles.description: Ipswich Town could well have their biggest-ever home attendance on a Boxing Day when Oxford United visit on Monday. MIKE BACON takes a look on how…
articles.content:
I'll be honest.
When Town's CEO Mark Ashton said at a Fans' Forum earlier this year that he saw no reason Portman Road couldn't average 28,000 attendances, I did raise my eyebrows a smidgen.
Not be… [+4009 chars]

articles.title: ‘I don’t have any regrets’: Eddie Jones insists his England were on right track - The Guardian
articles.description: Eddie Jones has insisted he had England ‘on the right track’ to peak at next year’s World Cup before he was sacked
articles.content: Eddie Jones has insisted he had England on the right track to peak at next years World Cup before he was sacked after seven years in charge, revealing he has held talks with other nations about takin… [+3579 chars]

articles.author: Gary Watkins
articles.title: Jani to leave Porsche works role after 963 LMDh snub - Autosport
articles.description: Le Mans 24 Hours and World Endurance Championship title winner Neel Jani is leaving Porsche at the end of this year after 10 seasons.
articles.content: The 39-year-old, who did the Le Mans/WEC title double with Porsche in 2016, has confirmed he will not be staying with a manufacturer he joined at the beginning of 2013 ahead of its WEC entry with the… [+3445 chars]

articles.author: Jacob Leeks
articles.title: Olivier Giroud 'pretended he couldn't speak English' in brutal World Cup shirt rejection - The Mirror
articles.description: Olivier Giroud spent nine years playing in the Premier League for Arsenal and Chelsea but claimed he could not speak English to avoid swapping shirts at the World Cup
articles.content:
Australia star Jason Cummings has revealed Olivier Giroud bizarrely pretended he couldn't speak English to avoid swapping shirts at the World Cup.
